documentation.name: Recent changes
documentation.description: Subscribe to @BotNews to be the first to know about the latest updates and join the discussion in @BotTalk

sections.name: September 6, 2024
sections.description: Bot API 7.10 - Added updates about purchased paid media, represented by the class PaidMediaPurchased and the field purchased_paid_media in the class Update. - Added the ability to specify a payload in sendPaidMedia that is received back by the bot in TransactionPartnerUser and purchased_paid_media updates. - Added the field prize_star_count to the classes GiveawayCreated, Giveaway, GiveawayWinners and ChatBoostSourceGiveaway. - Added the field is_star_giveaway to the class GiveawayCompleted. - Added the field SecondaryButton to the class WebApp. - Added the event secondaryButtonClicked for Mini Apps. - Added the field bottomBarColor and the method setBottomBarColor to the class WebApp. - Added the field bottom_bar_bg_color to the class ThemeParams.

sections.name: August 14, 2024
sections.description: Bot API 7.9 - Added support for Super Channels, allowing received channel messages to have users or other channels as their senders. - Added the ability to send paid media to any chat. - Added the parameter business_connection_id to the method sendPaidMedia, allowing bots to send paid media on behalf of a business account. - Added the field paid_media to the class TransactionPartnerUser for transactions involving paid media. - Added the fields subscription_period and subscription_price to the class ChatInviteLink. - Added the method createChatSubscriptionInviteLink, allowing bots to create subscription invite links. - Added the method editChatSubscriptionInviteLink, allowing bots to edit the name of subscription invite links. - Added the field until_date to the class ChatMemberMember for members with an active subscription. - Added support for paid reactions and the class ReactionTypePaid.

sections.name: July 31, 2024
sections.description: Bot API 7.8 - Added the option for bots to set a Main Mini App, which can be previewed and launched directly from a button in the bot's profile or a link. - Added the method shareToStory to the class WebApp. - Added the field has_main_web_app to the class User, which is returned in the response to getMe. - Added the parameter business_connection_id to the methods pinChatMessage and unpinChatMessage, allowing bots to manage pinned messages on behalf of a business account.

sections.name: July 7, 2024
sections.description: Bot API 7.7 - Added the class RefundedPayment, containing information about a refunded payment. - Added the field refunded_payment to the class Message, describing a service message about a refunded payment. - Added the field isVerticalSwipesEnabled and the methods enableVerticalSwipes, disableVerticalSwipes to the class WebApp. - Added the event scanQrPopupClosed for Mini Apps.

sections.name: July 1, 2024
sections.description: Bot API 7.6 - Added the classes PaidMedia, PaidMediaInfo, PaidMediaPreview, PaidMediaPhoto and PaidMediaVideo, containing information about paid media. - Added the method sendPaidMedia and the classes InputPaidMedia, InputPaidMediaPhoto and InputPaidMediaVideo, to support sending paid media. - Documented that the methods copyMessage and copyMessages cannot be used to copy paid media. - Added the field can_send_paid_media to the class ChatFullInfo. - Added the field paid_media to the classes Message and ExternalReplyInfo. - Added the class TransactionPartnerTelegramAds, containing information about Telegram Star transactions involving the Telegram Ads Platform. - Added the field invoice_payload to the class TransactionPartnerUser, containing the bot-specified invoice payload. - Changed the default opening mode for Direct Link Mini Apps. - Added support for launching Web Apps via t.me link in the class MenuButtonWebApp. - Added the field section_separator_color to the class ThemeParams. See earlier changes »

documentation.name: Authorizing your bot
documentation.description: Each bot is given a unique authentication token when it is created. The token looks something like 123456:ABC-DEF1234ghIkl-zyx57W2v1u123ew11, but we'll use simply <token> in this document instead. You can learn about obtaining tokens and generating new ones in this document.

documentation.name: Making requests
documentation.description: All queries to the Telegram Bot API must be served over HTTPS and need to be presented in this form: https://api.telegram.org/bot<token>/METHOD_NAME. Like this for example: https://api.telegram.org/bot123456:ABC-DEF1234ghIkl-zyx57W2v1u123ew11/getMe We support GET and POST HTTP methods. We support four ways of passing parameters in Bot API requests: - URL query string - application/x-www-form-urlencoded - application/json (except for uploading files) - multipart/form-data (use to upload files) The response contains a JSON object, which always has a Boolean field 'ok' and may have an optional String field 'description' with a human-readable description of the result. If 'ok' equals True, the request was successful and the result of the query can be found in the 'result' field. In case of an unsuccessful request, 'ok' equals false and the error is explained in the 'description'. An Integer 'error_code' field is also returned, but its contents are subject to change in the future. Some errors may also have an optional field 'parameters' of the type ResponseParameters, which can help to automatically handle the error. - All methods in the Bot API are case-insensitive. - All queries must be made using UTF-8.

sections.name: Making requests when getting updates
sections.description: If you're using webhooks, you can perform a request to the Bot API while sending an answer to the webhook. Use either application/json or application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data response content type for passing parameters. Specify the method to be invoked in the method parameter of the request. It's not possible to know that such a request was successful or get its result. Please see our FAQ for examples.

documentation.name: Using a Local Bot API Server
documentation.description: The Bot API server source code is available at telegram-bot-api. You can run it locally and send the requests to your own server instead of https://api.telegram.org. If you switch to a local Bot API server, your bot will be able to: - Download files without a size limit. - Upload files up to 2000 MB. - Upload files using their local path and the file URI scheme. - Use an HTTP URL for the webhook. - Use any local IP address for the webhook. - Use any port for the webhook. - Set max_webhook_connections up to 100000. - Receive the absolute local path as a value of the file_path field without the need to download the file after a getFile request.

sections.name: Do I need a Local Bot API Server
sections.description: The majority of bots will be OK with the default configuration, running on our servers. But if you feel that you need one of these features, you're welcome to switch to your own at any time.

documentation.name: Getting updates
documentation.description: There are two mutually exclusive ways of receiving updates for your bot - the getUpdates method on one hand and webhooks on the other. Incoming updates are stored on the server until the bot receives them either way, but they will not be kept longer than 24 hours. Regardless of which option you choose, you will receive JSON-serialized Update objects as a result.

sections.name: Update
sections.description: This object represents an incoming update.At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

parameters.name: update_id
parameters.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This identifier becomes especially handy if you're using webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

parameters.name: edited_message
parameters.description: New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.

parameters.name: channel_post
parameters.description: New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

parameters.name: edited_channel_post
parameters.description: New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.

parameters.name: business_connection
parameters.description: The bot was connected to or disconnected from a business account, or a user edited an existing connection with the bot

parameters.name: business_message
parameters.description: New message from a connected business account

parameters.name: edited_business_message
parameters.description: New version of a message from a connected business account

parameters.name: deleted_business_messages
parameters.description: Messages were deleted from a connected business account

parameters.name: message_reaction
parameters.description: A reaction to a message was changed by a user. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "message_reaction" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates. The update isn't received for reactions set by bots.

parameters.name: message_reaction_count
parameters.description: Reactions to a message with anonymous reactions were changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "message_reaction_count" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates. The updates are grouped and can be sent with delay up to a few minutes.

parameters.name: inline_query
parameters.description: New incoming inline query

parameters.name: chosen_inline_result
parameters.description: The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

parameters.name: callback_query
parameters.description: New incoming callback query

parameters.name: shipping_query
parameters.description: New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

parameters.name: pre_checkout_query
parameters.description: New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

parameters.name: purchased_paid_media
parameters.description: A user purchased paid media with a non-empty payload sent by the bot in a non-channel chat

parameters.name: poll
parameters.description: New poll state. Bots receive only updates about manually stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

parameters.name: poll_answer
parameters.description: A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

parameters.name: my_chat_member
parameters.description: The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

parameters.name: chat_member
parameters.description: A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "chat_member" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

parameters.name: chat_join_request
parameters.description: A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

parameters.name: chat_boost
parameters.description: A chat boost was added or changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.

parameters.name: removed_chat_boost
parameters.description: A boost was removed from a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.

sections.name: getUpdates
sections.description: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki). Returns an Array of Update objects.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as getUpdates is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will be forgotten.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

parameters.name: allowed_updates
parameters.description:
A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify ["message", "edited_channel_post", "callback_query"] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member, message_reaction, and message_reaction_count (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.

Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

sections.name: setWebhook
sections.description: Use this method to specify a URL and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified URL, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success. If you'd like to make sure that the webhook was set by you, you can specify secret data in the parameter secret_token. If specified, the request will contain a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” with the secret token as content.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: HTTPS URL to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

parameters.name: certificate
parameters.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

parameters.name: max_connections
parameters.description: The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

parameters.name: allowed_updates
parameters.description:
A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify ["message", "edited_channel_post", "callback_query"] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member, message_reaction, and message_reaction_count (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.
Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

parameters.name: drop_pending_updates
parameters.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

parameters.name: secret_token
parameters.description: A secret token to be sent in a header "X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token" in every webhook request, 1-256 characters. Only characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed. The header is useful to ensure that the request comes from a webhook set by you.

sections.name: deleteWebhook
sections.description: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to getUpdates. Returns True on success.

parameters.name: drop_pending_updates
parameters.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

sections.name: getWebhookInfo
sections.description: Use this method to get current webhook status. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a WebhookInfo object. If the bot is using getUpdates, will return an object with the url field empty.

sections.name: WebhookInfo
sections.description: Describes the current status of a webhook.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

parameters.name: has_custom_certificate
parameters.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

parameters.name: pending_update_count
parameters.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.description: Currently used webhook IP address

parameters.name: last_error_date
parameters.description: Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

parameters.name: last_error_message
parameters.description: Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

parameters.name: last_synchronization_error_date
parameters.description: Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

parameters.name: max_connections
parameters.description: The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

parameters.name: allowed_updates
parameters.description: A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

documentation.name: Available types
documentation.description:
All types used in the Bot API responses are represented as JSON-objects.
It is safe to use 32-bit signed integers for storing all Integer fields unless otherwise noted.
Optional fields may be not returned when irrelevant.

sections.name: User
sections.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: is_bot
parameters.description: True, if this user is a bot

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: User's or bot's first name

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: User's or bot's last name

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: User's or bot's username

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: IETF language tag of the user's language

parameters.name: is_premium
parameters.description: True, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

parameters.name: added_to_attachment_menu
parameters.description: True, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

parameters.name: can_join_groups
parameters.description: True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.

parameters.name: can_read_all_group_messages
parameters.description: True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.

parameters.name: supports_inline_queries
parameters.description: True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.

parameters.name: can_connect_to_business
parameters.description: True, if the bot can be connected to a Telegram Business account to receive its messages. Returned only in getMe.

parameters.name: has_main_web_app
parameters.description: True, if the bot has a main Web App. Returned only in getMe.

sections.name: Chat
sections.description: This object represents a chat.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the chat, can be either "private", "group", "supergroup" or "channel"

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: First name of the other party in a private chat

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the other party in a private chat

parameters.name: is_forum
parameters.description: True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)

sections.name: ChatFullInfo
sections.description: This object contains full information about a chat.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the chat, can be either "private", "group", "supergroup" or "channel"

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: First name of the other party in a private chat

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the other party in a private chat

parameters.name: is_forum
parameters.description: True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)

parameters.name: accent_color_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the accent color for the chat name and backgrounds of the chat photo, reply header, and link preview. See accent colors for more details.

parameters.name: max_reaction_count
parameters.description: The maximum number of reactions that can be set on a message in the chat

parameters.name: photo
parameters.description: Chat photo

parameters.name: active_usernames
parameters.description: If non-empty, the list of all active chat usernames; for private chats, supergroups and channels

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: For private chats, the date of birth of the user

parameters.name: business_intro
parameters.description: For private chats with business accounts, the intro of the business

parameters.name: business_location
parameters.description: For private chats with business accounts, the location of the business

parameters.name: business_opening_hours
parameters.description: For private chats with business accounts, the opening hours of the business

parameters.name: personal_chat
parameters.description: For private chats, the personal channel of the user

parameters.name: available_reactions
parameters.description: List of available reactions allowed in the chat. If omitted, then all emoji reactions are allowed.

parameters.name: background_custom_emoji_id
parameters.description: Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for the reply header and link preview background

parameters.name: profile_accent_color_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the accent color for the chat's profile background. See profile accent colors for more details.

parameters.name: profile_background_custom_emoji_id
parameters.description: Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for its profile background

parameters.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
parameters.description: Custom emoji identifier of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat

parameters.name: emoji_status_expiration_date
parameters.description: Expiration date of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat, in Unix time, if any

parameters.name: bio
parameters.description: Bio of the other party in a private chat

parameters.name: has_private_forwards
parameters.description: True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user

parameters.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
parameters.description: True, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat

parameters.name: join_to_send_messages
parameters.description: True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages

parameters.name: join_by_request
parameters.description: True, if all users directly joining the supergroup without using an invite link need to be approved by supergroup administrators

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats

parameters.name: invite_link
parameters.description: Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats

parameters.name: pinned_message
parameters.description: The most recent pinned message (by sending date)

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups

parameters.name: can_send_paid_media
parameters.description: True, if paid media messages can be sent or forwarded to the channel chat. The field is available only for channel chats.

parameters.name: slow_mode_delay
parameters.description: For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unprivileged user; in seconds

parameters.name: unrestrict_boost_count
parameters.description: For supergroups, the minimum number of boosts that a non-administrator user needs to add in order to ignore slow mode and chat permissions

parameters.name: message_auto_delete_time
parameters.description: The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds

parameters.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
parameters.description: True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators.

parameters.name: has_hidden_members
parameters.description: True, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat

parameters.name: has_protected_content
parameters.description: True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats

parameters.name: has_visible_history
parameters.description: True, if new chat members will have access to old messages; available only to chat administrators

parameters.name: sticker_set_name
parameters.description: For supergroups, name of the group sticker set

parameters.name: can_set_sticker_set
parameters.description: True, if the bot can change the group sticker set

parameters.name: custom_emoji_sticker_set_name
parameters.description: For supergroups, the name of the group's custom emoji sticker set. Custom emoji from this set can be used by all users and bots in the group.

parameters.name: linked_chat_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected

sections.name: Message
sections.description: This object represents a message.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

parameters.name: message_thread_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Sender of the message; may be empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats

parameters.name: sender_chat
parameters.description: Sender of the message when sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the supergroup itself for messages sent by its anonymous administrators or a linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the channel's discussion group. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats.

parameters.name: sender_boost_count
parameters.description: If the sender of the message boosted the chat, the number of boosts added by the user

parameters.name: sender_business_bot
parameters.description: The bot that actually sent the message on behalf of the business account. Available only for outgoing messages sent on behalf of the connected business account.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time. It is always a positive number, representing a valid date.

parameters.name: business_connection_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the business connection from which the message was received. If non-empty, the message belongs to a chat of the corresponding business account that is independent from any potential bot chat which might share the same identifier.

parameters.name: chat
parameters.description: Chat the message belongs to

parameters.name: forward_origin
parameters.description: Information about the original message for forwarded messages

parameters.name: is_topic_message
parameters.description: True, if the message is sent to a forum topic

parameters.name: is_automatic_forward
parameters.description: True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

parameters.name: reply_to_message
parameters.description: For replies in the same chat and message thread, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

parameters.name: external_reply
parameters.description: Information about the message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic

parameters.name: quote
parameters.description: For replies that quote part of the original message, the quoted part of the message

parameters.name: reply_to_story
parameters.description: For replies to a story, the original story

parameters.name: via_bot
parameters.description: Bot through which the message was sent

parameters.name: edit_date
parameters.description: Date the message was last edited in Unix time

parameters.name: has_protected_content
parameters.description: True, if the message can't be forwarded

parameters.name: is_from_offline
parameters.description: True, if the message was sent by an implicit action, for example, as an away or a greeting business message, or as a scheduled message

parameters.name: media_group_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

parameters.name: author_signature
parameters.description: Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

parameters.name: link_preview_options
parameters.description: Options used for link preview generation for the message, if it is a text message and link preview options were changed

parameters.name: effect_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the message effect added to the message

parameters.name: animation
parameters.description: Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: Message is an audio file, information about the file

parameters.name: document
parameters.description: Message is a general file, information about the file

parameters.name: paid_media
parameters.description: Message contains paid media; information about the paid media

parameters.name: photo
parameters.description: Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

parameters.name: sticker
parameters.description: Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

parameters.name: story
parameters.description: Message is a forwarded story

parameters.name: video
parameters.description: Message is a video, information about the video

parameters.name: video_note
parameters.description: Message is a video note, information about the video message

parameters.name: voice
parameters.description: Message is a voice message, information about the file

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: Caption for the animation, audio, document, paid media, photo, video or voice

parameters.name: caption_entities
parameters.description: For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

parameters.name: show_caption_above_media
parameters.description: True, if the caption must be shown above the message media

parameters.name: has_media_spoiler
parameters.description: True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

parameters.name: dice
parameters.description: Message is a dice with random value

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Message is a game, information about the game. More about games

parameters.name: poll
parameters.description: Message is a native poll, information about the poll

parameters.name: venue
parameters.description: Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Message is a shared location, information about the location

parameters.name: new_chat_members
parameters.description: New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

parameters.name: left_chat_member
parameters.description: A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

parameters.name: new_chat_title
parameters.description: A chat title was changed to this value

parameters.name: new_chat_photo
parameters.description: A chat photo was change to this value

parameters.name: delete_chat_photo
parameters.description: Service message: the chat photo was deleted

parameters.name: group_chat_created
parameters.description: Service message: the group has been created

parameters.name: supergroup_chat_created
parameters.description: Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

parameters.name: channel_chat_created
parameters.description: Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

parameters.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
parameters.description: Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

parameters.name: migrate_to_chat_id
parameters.description: The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: migrate_from_chat_id
parameters.description: The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: pinned_message
parameters.description: Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

parameters.name: invoice
parameters.description: Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments

parameters.name: successful_payment

parameters.name: refunded_payment

parameters.name: users_shared

parameters.name: chat_shared

parameters.name: connected_website
parameters.description: The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login

parameters.name: write_access_allowed
parameters.description: Service message: the user allowed the bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment or side menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess

parameters.name: passport_data

parameters.name: proximity_alert_triggered

parameters.name: boost_added

sections.name: MessageId
sections.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Unique message identifier

sections.name: InaccessibleMessage
sections.description: This object describes a message that was deleted or is otherwise inaccessible to the bot.

parameters.name: chat
parameters.description: Chat the message belonged to

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Always 0. The field can be used to differentiate regular and inaccessible messages.

sections.name: MaybeInaccessibleMessage
sections.description: This object describes a message that can be inaccessible to the bot. It can be one of - Message - InaccessibleMessage

sections.name: MessageEntity
sections.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be "mention" (@username), "hashtag" (#hashtag), "cashtag" ($USD), "bot_command" (/start@jobs_bot), "url" (https://telegram.org), "email" (do-not-reply@telegram.org), "phone_number" (+1-212-555-0123), "bold" (bold text), "italic" (italic text), "underline" (underlined text), "strikethrough" (strikethrough text), "spoiler" (spoiler message), "blockquote" (block quotation), "expandable_blockquote" (collapsed-by-default block quotation), "code" (monowidth string), "pre" (monowidth block), "text_link" (for clickable text URLs), "text_mention" (for users without usernames), "custom_emoji" (for inline custom emoji stickers)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: For "text_link" only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: For "text_mention" only, the mentioned user

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: For "pre" only, the programming language of the entity text

parameters.name: custom_emoji_id
parameters.description: For "custom_emoji" only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use getCustomEmojiStickers to get full information about the sticker

sections.name: TextQuote
sections.description: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are kept in quotes.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender

parameters.name: is_manual
parameters.description: True, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.

sections.name: ExternalReplyInfo
sections.description: This object contains information about a message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Origin of the message replied to by the given message

parameters.name: chat
parameters.description: Chat the original message belongs to. Available only if the chat is a supergroup or a channel.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Unique message identifier inside the original chat. Available only if the original chat is a supergroup or a channel.

parameters.name: link_preview_options
parameters.description: Options used for link preview generation for the original message, if it is a text message

parameters.name: animation
parameters.description: Message is an animation, information about the animation

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: Message is an audio file, information about the file

parameters.name: document
parameters.description: Message is a general file, information about the file

parameters.name: paid_media
parameters.description: Message contains paid media; information about the paid media

parameters.name: photo
parameters.description: Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

parameters.name: sticker
parameters.description: Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

parameters.name: story
parameters.description: Message is a forwarded story

parameters.name: video
parameters.description: Message is a video, information about the video

parameters.name: video_note
parameters.description: Message is a video note, information about the video message

parameters.name: voice
parameters.description: Message is a voice message, information about the file

parameters.name: has_media_spoiler
parameters.description: True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

parameters.name: dice
parameters.description: Message is a dice with random value

parameters.name: game
parameters.description: Message is a game, information about the game. More about games

parameters.name: giveaway
parameters.description: Message is a scheduled giveaway, information about the giveaway

parameters.name: giveaway_winners
parameters.description: A giveaway with public winners was completed

parameters.name: invoice
parameters.description: Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Message is a shared location, information about the location

parameters.name: poll
parameters.description: Message is a native poll, information about the poll

parameters.name: venue
parameters.description: Message is a venue, information about the venue

sections.name: ReplyParameters
sections.description: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat chat_id if it is specified

parameters.name: chat_id
parameters.description: If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

parameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
parameters.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always False for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always True for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

parameters.name: quote
parameters.description: Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.

parameters.name: quote_parse_mode
parameters.description: Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See formatting options for more details.

parameters.name: quote_entities
parameters.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of quote_parse_mode.

parameters.name: quote_position
parameters.description: Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units

sections.name: MessageOrigin
sections.description: This object describes the origin of a message. It can be one of - MessageOriginUser - MessageOriginHiddenUser - MessageOriginChat - MessageOriginChannel

sections.name: MessageOriginUser
sections.description: The message was originally sent by a known user.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the message origin, always "user"

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

parameters.name: sender_user
parameters.description: User that sent the message originally

sections.name: MessageOriginHiddenUser
sections.description: The message was originally sent by an unknown user.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the message origin, always "hidden_user"

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

parameters.name: sender_user_name
parameters.description: Name of the user that sent the message originally

sections.name: MessageOriginChat
sections.description: The message was originally sent on behalf of a chat to a group chat.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the message origin, always "chat"

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

parameters.name: sender_chat
parameters.description: Chat that sent the message originally

parameters.name: author_signature
parameters.description: For messages originally sent by an anonymous chat administrator, original message author signature

sections.name: MessageOriginChannel
sections.description: The message was originally sent to a channel chat.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the message origin, always "channel"

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

parameters.name: chat
parameters.description: Channel chat to which the message was originally sent

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

parameters.name: author_signature
parameters.description: Signature of the original post author

sections.name: PhotoSize

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

parameters.name: file_unique_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Photo width

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Photo height

parameters.name: file_size
parameters.description: File size in bytes

sections.name: Animation

parameters.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

parameters.name: file_unique_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Video height as defined by the sender

parameters.name: duration

parameters.description: File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

parameters.name: file_size

parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The video

parameters.description: Contact's phone number

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: Contact's first name

parameters.name: last_name

But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

parameters.name: vcard
parameters.description: Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

sections.name: Dice
sections.description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for "", "" and "" base emoji, 1-5 for "" and "" base emoji, 1-64 for "" base emoji

sections.name: PollOption
sections.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

parameters.name: text_entities
parameters.description: Special entities that appear in the option text. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed in poll option texts

parameters.name: voter_count
parameters.description: Number of users that voted for this option

sections.name: InputPollOption
sections.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll to be sent.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

parameters.name: text_parse_mode
parameters.description: Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed

parameters.name: text_entities
parameters.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll option text. It can be specified instead of text_parse_mode

sections.name: PollAnswer
sections.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

parameters.name: poll_id
parameters.description: Unique poll identifier

parameters.name: voter_chat
parameters.description: The chat that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter is anonymous

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter isn't anonymous

parameters.name: option_ids
parameters.description: 0-based identifiers of chosen answer options. May be empty if the vote was retracted.

sections.name: Poll
sections.description: This object contains information about a poll.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique poll identifier

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

parameters.name: question_entities
parameters.description: Special entities that appear in the question. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed in poll questions

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: List of poll options

parameters.name: total_voter_count
parameters.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

parameters.name: is_closed
parameters.description: True, if the poll is closed

parameters.name: is_anonymous
parameters.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Poll type, currently can be "regular" or "quiz"

parameters.name: allows_multiple_answers
parameters.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

parameters.name: correct_option_id
parameters.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

parameters.name: explanation
parameters.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

parameters.name: explanation_entities
parameters.description: Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

parameters.name: open_period
parameters.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

parameters.name: close_date
parameters.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

sections.name: Location
sections.description: This object represents a point on the map.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude as defined by the sender

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude as defined by the sender

parameters.name: horizontal_accuracy
parameters.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

parameters.name: live_period
parameters.description: Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

parameters.name: heading
parameters.description: The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

parameters.name: proximity_alert_radius
parameters.description: The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

sections.name: Venue
sections.description: This object represents a venue.

parameters.name: google_place_id
parameters.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

parameters.name: google_place_type
parameters.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

sections.name: WebAppData
sections.description: Describes data sent from a Web App to the bot.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

parameters.name: button_text
parameters.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

sections.name: ProximityAlertTriggered

parameters.name: watcher

parameters.name: distance

sections.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged

parameters.name: message_auto_delete_time
parameters.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

sections.name: ChatBoostAdded

parameters.name: boost_count

sections.name: BackgroundFill
sections.description: This object describes the way a background is filled based on the selected colors. Currently, it can be one of - BackgroundFillSolid - BackgroundFillGradient - BackgroundFillFreeformGradient

sections.name: BackgroundFillSolid
sections.description: The background is filled using the selected color.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the background fill, always "solid"

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the background fill in the RGB24 format

sections.name: BackgroundFillGradient
sections.description: The background is a gradient fill.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the background fill, always "gradient"

parameters.name: top_color
parameters.description: Top color of the gradient in the RGB24 format

parameters.name: bottom_color

parameters.name: rotation_angle

sections.name: BackgroundFillFreeformGradient
sections.description: The background is a freeform gradient that rotates after every message in the chat.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the background fill, always "freeform_gradient"

parameters.name: colors
